page.title: 01Valley Northeast of Ludlow
page.content: A section of hill slope to the East of Brown Clee Hill, ranging from 450m in the west, fairly evenly to 190m in the east. Drainage, by four main streamsis Easterly into Rea Brook beyond. The B4364, Ludlow to Bridgenorth Road, crosses the block south-north and 6 other lanes traverse the area. Three small hamlets lie on these routes at varying heights between 180m and 250m above sea level. Burwarton Village is at a similar height on the road. The hamlets each have a thriving church, while Burwarton has lost its church and it is being converted into a house. A Methodist chapel nearby has closed. Apart from the clusters of farm and cottages, there are some farms and cottages spread over the area. A portion of land in the northwest is parkland and forest in the Burwarton
